H0.text: Abrasive mechanical weathering occurs when one rock bumps against another rock.

H1.text: Absorption is the type of mechanical weathering that occurs when one rock bumps against another rock.

H2.text: Refraction is the type of mechanical weathering that occurs when one rock bumps against another rock.

H3.text: Disintegration is the type of mechanical weathering that occurs when one rock bumps against another rock.

A4.text: Abrasion is the natural scratching of bedrock by a continuous movement of snow or glacier downhill.

A5.text: Abrasion occurs as a result of two surfaces rubbing against each other, resulting in the wearing down of one or both of the surfaces.
